intro: Acidosasa edulis, commonly known as the sour leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its small, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruits are edible but have a tart, acidic flavor, which is why it is named "edulis." The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
